title: Neptune's Staircase Walk Route

images.title: Colin Smith / The Top of Neptune's Staircase
images.caption: The Top of Neptune's Staircase. Near the southern end of the Caledonian Canal, 8 locks take craft up/down 20 metres over a distance of 450 metres. In the distance is Loch Linnhe.

description: This wonder of engineering was constructed in the early 19th century by Thomas Telford. It is noteworthy as the longest staircase lock flight in Scotland. You can start your walk from the Neptune's Staircase car park next to the Banavie Swing Bridge. You can then pick up a lovely surfaced footpath running along the Caledonian Canal and the locks. After about 10 minutes there's a footbridge where you can cross over and walk along the other side of the canal. It's a very photogenic area with the nearby Ben Nevis making a fine backdrop. You can extend the walk by heading north east along the canal and the Great Glen Way to visit Loch Lochy .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Moorings Hotel overlooks the canal. You can sit outside on the decking area and enjoy lovely views of the lock flight.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To the north east there's the interesting village of Spean Bridge. Here you can enjoy pleasant walks along the River Spean and climb to the Commando Monument where there is a noteworthy memorial and a splendid viewpoint.

display_address: Neptune's Staircase, B8004, Banavie, Highland, Alba / Scotland, PH33 7LY, United Kingdom
